questions.question: What does a red traffic light signal mean?
questions.explanation: A red traffic light signal means stop. You can make a right turn after you stop and yield to pedestrians and other traffic.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond signs are used to warn drivers of potential hazards or changes in road conditions.

questions.question: What does a solid white line indicate?
questions.explanation: A solid white line means that lane changes are discouraged or unsafe.

questions.question: At an intersection, who has the right-of-way when both vehicles arrive at the same time?
questions.explanation: At intersections without stop or yield signs, yield to the vehicle on the right if two vehicles arrive at the same time.

questions.question: When merging onto a freeway, who has the right-of-way?
options: The vehicle already on the freeway
The vehicle in the left lane
The vehicle in the right lane
questions.correctAnswer: The vehicle already on the freeway
questions.explanation: Vehicles already on the freeway have the right-of-way. You must adjust your speed to match the flow of traffic before merging.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit in a residential area if not posted?
questions.explanation: In residential areas, the speed limit is typically 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use:
questions.explanation: In fog, use your low beam headlights to reduce the glare and reflection.

questions.question: In California, it is illegal to park:
options: Within 15 feet of a fire hydrant
Within 30 feet of a stop sign
questions.explanation: In California, it is illegal to park within 15 feet of a fire hydrant, within 20 feet of a crosswalk, and within 30 feet of a stop sign.

questions.question: What should you do if your brakes fail while driving?
options: Shift to a lower gear and look for a place to slow to a stop
Honk the horn to alert other drivers
questions.correctAnswer: Shift to a lower gear and look for a place to slow to a stop
questions.explanation: If your brakes fail, shift to a lower gear and look for a place to slow to a stop. Pumping the brake pedal may also help build up brake pressure.

questions.question: What does a green arrow traffic signal mean?
options: Proceed with caution in the direction of the arrow
Stop and wait for the green light
Turn in the direction of the arrow after yielding to traffic
Turn in the direction of the arrow, traffic has been cleared
questions.correctAnswer: Turn in the direction of the arrow, traffic has been cleared
questions.explanation: A green arrow means 'GO'. You have the right-of-way and may turn in the direction the arrow is pointing after you yield to any vehicles, bicycles, or pedestrians still in the intersection.
